tweets.text: Custodian of the landscape? The landowner cuts the fallow in late June  destroying skylark nests & ploughs in autumn leaving soil bare. #SoWrong @NaturalEngland @NEFieldUnit @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA https://t.co/hU6qtZV93Y

We've removed two flood warnings on the Aire and Calder Navigation between #Pollington and #Goole. Water levels have stabilised following a multi-agency operation led by @CanalRiverTrust to repair a breach in the embankment. https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/3ANxhkQIOc

There are also 5 flood alerts in place for Lincolnshire.

Read more: https://t.co/psHVAznntY

Don't forget to sign up to flood warnings on the link belowüëá #Lincolnshire #Flood https://t.co/Rr7zxPoilR

Heavy rain has fallen much of today, as a result it‚Äôs likely we will be issuing 5 flood warnings along the Exe this evening, including Exeter Quay and Trews Weir. We are closely monitoring the situation.
Keep checking our flood warning page https://t.co/BrVUZau8m6

#Waste crime does not pay! 

Read about a case in #Worcester which has brought a court order for the convicted offender to pay some ¬£2.1 million. 

Great work by our enforcement & legal teams.

https://t.co/CHX7kf4h4Z https://t.co/UtiauekEt1

Hylton Road #Worcester will close at 6am tomorrow for approx. 2 hours for the installation of additional flood pumps - follow local diversions 

@worcscc @myworcester @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA

New socially distanced band pic with @EnvAgencyYNE this week- but whats our name? #BeKind ! @PaulSwaz @mrsk3r @cathseal1  @VolkerStevinUK @johncurtinEA Mytholmroyd's new ¬£41m flood defences are ready for winter to better protect 400 homes & businesses. https://t.co/SRqfd96VAU

Check out our new video! Learn how #PropertyFloodResilience measures have changed the lives of four people living in the #SouthWest of England:
https://t.co/4m7SFrf8vK

#BeFloodReady
@CornwallCouncil @EnvAgencySW @DevonCC @Torbay_Council @plymouthcc @IoSCouncil

We've issued a Flood Warning for R Aller at Piles Mill, Lower Allerford & the Higher Allerford Rd. River levels have risen rapidly as result of heavy rainfall & we expect river levels to remain high until tomorrow morning-keep an eye on our flood warnings 
https://t.co/BrVUZau8m6 https://t.co/ldAE3nEq9s

A lot of news out there...

But don't forget the weather...

Tell friends to follow us and @metoffice for updates... or these great accounts if you've family across England: @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencyMids and/or @EnvAgencySW 
#floodaware https://t.co/IaQXwjnoLe

tweets.text:
Who's cooking #ChristmasDinner this year?

Remember not to pour fats, oils & grease down the sink as they can lead to a build up of #fatbergs, causing blockages & pollution. 

Instead leave to cool then scrape into the food waste or bin instead. 

Don't feed a festive #fatberg https://t.co/mEP1huobKh

tweets.text:
Heavy rain is expected across the south of England, parts of the Midlands, Lincolnshire and East Anglia on Wednesday and Thursday. This could lead to flooding.

Stay safe and don‚Äôt walk or drive through flood water.

Sign up to get warnings in England: https://t.co/P5d6Axp8Vq https://t.co/ForWYmQhK8

tweets.text: Heavy rain forecast across some parts of the the south west this evening, falling on already saturated land. We continue to closely monitor the situation, responding as necessary. Our teams are already out clearing trash screens. One flood warning issued for the Washford River.

7th Dec the bund has failed the EA has failed in its duties to protect this river and this needs a proper investigation @jamesowild @Feargal_Sharkey @N_Rivers_Trust @The_WMA @WestNorfolkBC @DefraWater @JamesBevanEA @NENorfolkSufflk @WildTroutTrust @ChalkStreamMon https://t.co/crPj1TvJ4o https://t.co/pvEpeRXZzL

@PhilNash2 @TimGue1 @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK With more climate challenges, we might consider shorter supply chains & more produce closer to point of consumption.
